metadata.Title: CVE-2013-4510 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Directory traversal vulnerability in the client in Tryton 3.0.0, as distributed before 20131104 and earlier, allows remote servers to write arbitrary files via path separators in the extension of a report.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2013-4510` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

tryton-client - 2.8.4-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: tryton-client package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.8.4-1').
